HERE‚ÄôS TODAY‚ÄôS FOX BUSINESS SEGMENT

‚Ä¢ The ‚ÄúSaaSpocalypse‚Äù 2026: legacy SaaS gets repriced as the plumbing layer in an agentic AI stack
‚Ä¢ Where value is migrating in the Agentic AI Stack: orchestration, security, connectivity, and data
‚Ä¢ Cyber picks for the agentic era: $CRWD as the interaction layer for agents, $RBRK as the ‚Äúundo button‚Äù for agents & $ZS as the control plane for agent traffic
‚Ä¢ Why AI systems can‚Äôt function without clean, well-organized data: $SNOW, $MDB
‚Ä¢ The enterprise AI bottleneck: nobody is better positioned than $PLTR sitting between cheap, powerful models & messy, valuable enterprise data
‚Ä¢ Picks-and-shovels winner in agentic AI: $NET

$GOOGL is rolling out AI music generation inside Gemini extending it beyond text and images.

The feature runs on DeepMind‚Äôs Lyria 3 model showing Google pushing Gemini toward a full multimodal creative platform
$PLTR UP OVER 5% TODAY

Warren Buffett‚Äôs latest Berkshire portfolio is out.

There is essentially zero exposure to the AI infrastructure buildout.

$TEM launched a new HRD-RNA test that uses gene expression to identify tumors with homologous recombination deficiency.

This helps doctors better select patients who are likely to benefit from platinum chemotherapy or PARP inhibitors.

$ONDS is pursuing an acquisition of Aeronautics, the Rafael-owned drone maker behind the Orbiter UAV platform.

It fits Ondas‚Äô broader push into Israel‚Äôs defense ecosystem alongside talks with mPrest and Controp.

Mizuho upgrades Palantir $PLTR to Outperform and raises its price target to $195.

If the market wants to throw a fit over multiples in a risk-off tape then that‚Äôs the cost of owning the category leader building the decision layer between AI models and valuable enterprise data.

$GOOGL is building new subsea fiber routes linking India with the U.S. and parts of the Southern Hemisphere under its ‚ÄúAmerica‚ÄìIndia Connect‚Äù initiative.

Part of Google‚Äôs $15B, five-year push to scale AI infrastructure in India and hardwire its global data backbone.

$NVDA CEO Jensen Huang says Nvidia is preparing new chips for GTC 2026 ‚Äúthe world has never seen before.‚Äù

Signals Nvidia‚Äôs product cadence is still accelerating even as Blackwell and Rubin are just ramping.

$META and $NVDA expand their partnership to deploy Nvidia‚Äôs full AI stack across Meta‚Äôs hyperscale data centers.

Meta is rolling out millions of Blackwell + Rubin GPUs alongside Grace CPUs + Spectrum-X networking to scale training and inference across its platforms.

Anthropic‚Äôs annualized revenue run rate reached $14 billion, rising more than 10X in each of the last three years, with >$100K customers rising 7X YoY. 

Claude Code reached a >$2.5 billion run rate, more than doubling since the start of 2026 with WAUs also doubling. For perspective, Claude Code achieved this in just ten months. 

$NVDA $AMZN $GOOG

Nvidia $NVDA announced a multi-year deal with Meta $META spanning 'millions' of Blackwell and Rubin GPUs,  as well as stand-alone CPU deployments.

Nvidia says it marks the first large-scale Grace CPU deployment, with potential for large-scale Vera CPU deployments in 2027.

Anthropic: "Training a single frontier AI model will soon require gigawatts of power, and the US AI sector will need at least 50 gigawatts of capacity over the next several years."

$NVDA $AMD $AVGO $AMZN $GOOG

Anthropic announced its newest model, Claude Sonnet 4.6, its second major model launch in less than two weeks.

Anthropic says the new model delivers improvements in coding, long-context reasoning, agent planning, knowledge tasks and more. 

$GOOG $AMZN $MSFT $NVDA

Alphabet $GOOG is turning to geothermal power for its data center operations in Nevada, with Ormat signing a 150MW power purchase agreement with NV Energy to support Alphabet's operations in the state. 

Projects are expected to come online from 2028 through 2030.

$MSFT $AMZN

üì∫ RED DOG REVERSAL IN $AMZN & $NVDA ‚Äî TEXTBOOK SETUP

In this short video, I cover two classic Red Dog Reversal setups ‚Äî one in $AMZN and one in $NVDA ‚Äî and both turned into strong tactical opportunities.

Two different stocks. Two different sectors. Same pattern: sellers got exhausted, key levels were reclaimed, and strong tactical bounces followed.

But these were just trades, not long-term investment signals. The market is still in a broader zone of resistance. 

The real question now is: how much of the early strength holds? If it fades, these were tactical squeezes. If it builds, you start shifting bias.

If you enjoyed this video, please ‚ù§Ô∏èlike and üîÅretweet

üì∫ FAILED BREAKDOWN, BUT STILL A SELL-THE-BOUNCE MARKET

I expected a possible downside range resolution yesterday, but that did not happen
‚Äì $SPY held $675‚Äì$676, reclaimed Friday‚Äôs low, and triggered a tactical reversal.
‚Äì $QQQ broke down, reclaimed a key level, and gave a small tactical bounce.

However, it does not mean new highs are coming, the correction is over, or the market is suddenly bullish.

There‚Äôs still overhead resistance. If price can‚Äôt clear prior highs, this bounce can turn into a lower high and roll back over.

This is still a range market. In range markets, failed breakdowns bounce ‚Äî and those bounces often get sold.

$SPX futures +30 after holding key range support 6780‚Äì6790 again ‚Äî that zone remains intact. For active traders, look for tactical RDR-type buys, then trim & trail into early strength while we manage the range. Resistance: 6880‚Äì6902

$spx futures +40 after $spy held $675 and reclaimed $677 to keep the range intact yesterday.   A few RDR‚Äôs across the board to cover some shorts and put on small risk.  We‚Äôll see if early strength holds or fades

Japan is one of the world‚Äôs largest net external creditors.

Huge overseas asset base.

Massive cross-border exposure.

A sharp yen appreciation doesn‚Äôt just hit FX traders.

It can pressure global asset flows.

Currency shocks travel.
I will laugh my ass off if after this intraday surge stocks close the day red.

Borrow yen.
Buy higher-yielding assets.
Collect the spread.

The catch?

Carry behaves like a short-volatility strategy.
When FX volatility spikes, unwind risk accelerates.

Oil shock ‚Üí FX vol ‚Üí yen strength ‚Üí liquidity tightens.

Chain reactions move fast.

The politicians and Fed created the affordability crisis.

All of them.

And now you expect them to solve it?

Austerity is the only answer.

Oil trades on probabilities ‚Äî not just supply.
